title.narrative: CitiesAdapt - Strengthening Climate Change Adaptation in Cities

description.narrative: Rapid urbanisation and the impacts of climate change is increasing the pressure to implement adaptation measures in fast-growing secondary cities in Mexico and South Africa. In both countries, climate change adaptation is hampered by a lack of capacity of cities, inadequate urban development instruments and an insufficient degree of vertical integration. Against this background, the project seeks to improve the mainstreaming of climate change adaptation in urban development by strengthening the capacities of two partner cities for pro-poor and climate-resilient urban planning. Building on the experiences with concrete demonstration projects for climate change adaptation of public spaces in selected neighbourhoods, The project will support the development of innovative climate change adaptation model approaches. The project features strong mechanisms of peer-to-peer learning and scaling-up between the project´s partner cities, mentor and transfer cities as well as national ministries relevant for climate change adaptation and urban development.
